page.title: 17Holiday Homes- Severn Valley
page.content: There are 5 areas with caravans and Shack sites totalling some 283 dwellings, the majority of which are for holiday use by their owners. They were built just after the 2nd world war before the existence of planning regulations. A survey of the sites was done in 1979. There are a few caravans which are inhabited for 8-10 months a year, but mostly shacks which are made of wood and asbestos with bitumen felt roofs. Many have gardens and trees around them and, as most are on hillsides, blend into their surroundings well. Folly Point has 6 shacks, Severn Meadow 52 shacks and 2 caravans, Northwood Lane 10 shacks, Hill Farm 130 shacks and 7 caravans, Hawkbatch Farm 45 shacks and 31 caravans. They are used mostly by Midlanders.
